page.title: 04HOUSING IN STRACHAN
page.content: There are about 60 house-holds in our area. In the village itself there are old established cottages,a farm, some council houses built prewar and a new estate of private houses built in 1981 Most of the houses are detached but there is a row of well spaced out semi -detached bungalows to the west of the village hall. There are at least 7 farmhouses in the district. Most of them are working crofts or farms. Some old properties have been bought and renovated as private dwellings. There is a caravan site and some farms hire out caravans to holiday makers. The older houses are built with local stone and are usually two stories high with slate roofs.
